definition: popular tradition/folk legend
surname Min
the people/nationality/citizen
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Dragon is one of the most sacred figures in ancient folk tales of the Bai People.
sentences.chinese: 龍是古代白族民間傳說中最受崇拜的神靈之一。

sentences.english: Even today, romantic lore commonly identifies chocolate as an aphrodisiac.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫的民間傳說通常認爲巧克力是一種催情劑。

sentences.english: A gnome that haunts underground places in German folklore.
sentences.chinese: 地靈德國民間傳說中在地下出沒的地神。

sentences.english: Chinese folk legend, the solar eclipse is "Tengu" caused by swallowing the sun.
sentences.chinese: 中國民間傳說中，日食是“天狗”吞食太陽造成的。

sentences.english: It could be a folk tale. It could be a history book.
sentences.chinese: 可以是民間傳說，也可以是歷史書。

sentences.english: There are also a lot of folklores and tales around this neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 這一帶還有許多的民間傳說和故事。

sentences.english: According to a Chinese folktale, Fairy Chang E lives with her moon rabbit in the Moon Palace.
sentences.chinese: 民間傳說月亮上有廣寒宮，宮裏住着嫦娥和玉兔。

sentences.english: The origin of the $ sign has several folkloric stories attached.
sentences.chinese: 美元的符號$的起源與好幾種民間傳說有關。

sentences.english: Mirrors have always held relevance in folklore when associated with death.
sentences.chinese: 鏡子這一物件總是出現在與死亡有關的民間傳說中。

sentences.english: The Jack-o-lantern (3) custom probably comes from Irish folklore.
sentences.chinese: 傑克燈大概出自愛爾蘭民間傳說。

sentences.english: Chao Kung-ming, God of Wealth in Chinese folklore.
sentences.chinese: 趙公元帥是中國民間傳說的財神，叫趙公明。

sentences.english: They are three gods popular among Chinese country people.
sentences.chinese: 中國民間傳說中的三位星君。

sentences.english: My favorite folktale is about a princess and a frog.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜歡的民間傳說是有關一位公主和一隻青蛙。

sentences.english: In folklore, shape- shifters are beings with the ability to become anyone or anything.
sentences.chinese: 民間傳說會移形大法者是能夠成爲任何事物的人。

sentences.english: The Butterfly Lovers or Liang Zhu is one of the four famousest Chinese legends.
sentences.chinese: 梁祝傳說是我國四大民間傳說之一。

sentences.english: Although this is a folk legend, but the spring is not the old Baoding indeed unique.
sentences.chinese: 這雖是民間傳說，但保定的春不老確實有獨到之處。

definition: folk story/folktale
Lü Dongbin (796-), Tang Dynasty scholar, one of the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
Wu Cheng'en (1500-1582), author (or compiler) of novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记
banner/standard/variant of 標誌|标志[biao1 zhi4]
tuning/temperament
a popular form of narrative literature flourishing in the Tang Dynasty (618-907) with alternate prose and rhymed parts for recitation and singing (often on Buddhist themes)
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
motif (loanword)/main idea/theme
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
founding master of a monastery/founder/originator

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
